climbs.name: Spring Loaded
climbs.fa: Andy Bowen (or not, let's cry about it)

content.description:
Spring Loaded is on the same rock and has the same start as

Bull's Eye

. Move left into huge hole (bull's eye) and find the best position to get ready for a 6 foot launch. With right hand in the hole and left on sidepull, jug thing, JUMP for the awesome positive lip! Be careful hanging on with one arm - it got me an elbow hyperextension out of the deal. :)
content.location:
This is up and right from

Barn Door

and up and straight from

The Millennium Falcon

.

content.description: Starting is tough, but the mono right hand and two finger left are plenty to pull up and balance on feet. Then grab that huge hole in the rock with left hand. Stay balanced, and reposition left hand on the right side of the big hole so you can reach as far right with your right hand as possible. The sloping ledge over there is great if you nail the spot. You will feel the barndoor swing coming, so throw a high right foot to maintain balance, work the ledge eventually finding pockets across the top, and move back left a few moves for the awesome lip. Top out.
content.location:
It is up the hill and right from

Barn Door

, or up the hill and straight from

The Millennium Falcon

.
